name: marketing
description: Patterns overused in AI-generated marketing copy — landing pages, product descriptions, newsletters, social posts. The most recognizable AI slop domain because the patterns are so uniform.

words.note: the single most AI-marketing word; almost never used by human copywriters
nothing is effortless; this word erases the value proposition
AI reach for 'custom' that sounds fancier

trigrams.phrase: take it to the next level

trigrams.note: as in 'unlock the power of' or 'harness the power of'
'whether you're a beginner or expert' — AI inclusivity formula

patterns.name: imagine_world
patterns.description: AI 'Imagine a world where' / 'What if you could' opener
patterns.note: The AI marketing opener. Immediately signals generated copy.

patterns.name: ready_to_cta
patterns.note: The universal AI call-to-action. Human copywriters are more specific.

patterns.name: not_just_product
patterns.description: AI product elevation: '[product] isn't just X — it's Y'
patterns.note: Everything AI sells is 'more than just a product.' Name the actual difference.

patterns.name: designed_for
patterns.note: Everyone says 'built for you.' Say what it actually does for them.

patterns.name: everything_you_need
patterns.description: AI completeness claim: 'everything you need to [verb]'
patterns.note: Vague completeness claim. Specifics sell better.

patterns.name: trusted_by
patterns.description: AI social proof formula: 'trusted by X+ [noun]'
patterns.note: Legitimate when true. AI generates these even without data.

patterns.name: exclamation_hype
patterns.description: AI hype punctuation: excessive exclamation marks
patterns.note: Multiple exclamation marks signal AI enthusiasm inflation.
